title: Constantinople Progress Tracker
body:
This issue is meant to track the progress of client implementation and tests of the EIPs for the upcoming Constantinople hard fork.

Migrated to https://github.com/ethereum/pm/wiki/Constantinople-Progress-Tracker

## [Test Cases Spreadsheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1xat7UI8GtB4ZGVdlK5_XQSHJZaMThi4SrlcL8XMZb5Q/edit#gid=1811198384)

Parity Ethereum: 
- EIP-1052 :white_check_mark: Yes https://github.com/paritytech/parity-ethereum/pull/9234
- EIP-1087 :exclamation:  needs discussion https://github.com/paritytech/parity-ethereum/issues/8427#issuecomment-408782377 

Did we decide to drop EIP-210? https://github.com/paritytech/parity-ethereum/pull/5505
Is EIP-1108 and EIP-1109 going to be included in Constantinople ?

Trinity: Here is the issue link for EIP1052

https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm/issues/719

@Souptacular you can check EIP 145 for Trinity. It's implemented in https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm/pull/1134 and https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm/pull/1112 which are both merged in latest master
@Souptacular and EIP1052 landed in Trinity as well https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm/pull/1147

Can we eventually add progress on the test cases written in https://github.com/ethereum/tests to the progress tracker, maybe with the number of implemented/merged test cases on the column for an EIP? @winsvega?

Have absolutely no overview on the current state there.

In this context I just rediscovered [this](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1xat7UI8GtB4ZGVdlK5_XQSHJZaMThi4SrlcL8XMZb5Q/edit#gid=1811198384) test cases collection spreadsheet for Metropolis, is this still updated/cared for or is there an alternative collection like this existing?
yes. that google list is tracking new tests since before Metropolis. It is being updated.

@winsvega Ah great, would be really good if you guys can keep the doc as up-to-date as possible and also make it clear which tests are implemented and where to find the implementation (like being done in the ``RETURN CODES`` sheet e.g.). This really helps us a lot on the implementation side!

We implemented `CREATE2` in Trinity. I will add that in contrast to the other new opcodes though, this one hasn't received much testing yet

https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm/pull/1186

EthereumJ/Harmony:
EIP 145: Bitwise shifting instructions in EVM implemented
EIP 1052: EXTCODEHASH Opcode implemented
everything else in progress
Can the links to 145/1014 be updated to point to their respective eips.ethereum.org page? 1014 points to the pull request, which makes it difficult for people unfamiliar with git to read it.

Parity Ethereum merged EIP-1283 https://github.com/paritytech/parity-ethereum/pull/9319

Parity Ethereum PR for EIP-1234 is https://github.com/paritytech/parity-ethereum/pull/9480 now (merged)

Parity Ethereum is feature-complete. https://github.com/paritytech/parity-ethereum/pull/9505
@Souptacular : what about [ᴇɪᴘ86](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-86.md#parameters) which was planned for Metropolis ?

@Souptacular I think the link is broken for geth - EIP 1283

It should be https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/17383
